attractions.name: Zhongshuge Bookstore
attractions.notes: Architectural Digest's 'world's most majestic bookstore' - features stunning architecture across multiple floors. Perfect INFJ spot, locals-only gem. Free admission.

attractions.name: Beicang Creative Park
attractions.notes: Over 40 independent designer boutiques, bilingual art workshops, creative markets on weekends. Hidden gem off Google Maps. Free admission.

attractions.name: Mountain City Alley
attractions.notes: Quaint cafes where locals sip coffee, street artists, ancient walls. Former US Embassy converted to café. Estimated €5 for coffee.

attractions.name: Xiahaoli Cultural Area
attractions.location: Connected to Longmenhao Old Street, Chongqing
attractions.notes: Beautiful when evening lights come on. Features bookstores, tea houses, and coffee shops. Perfect for relaxed exploration after jet lag.

attractions.name: Nankan Scenic Area (South Kan Cliff Carvings)
attractions.location: Nankan Mountain, southern suburb of Bazhong
attractions.notes: Tang Dynasty (618-907) cliff face Buddha statues - 122 intact niches with 1800 statues. Historical site with profound heritage. Estimated ticket ~30 RMB (€4).

attractions.name: Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding
attractions.notes: MUST arrive at 9:00 AM when pandas are most active. Feb is low season: hours 8:00-17:30. Adult ticket ~7.61 USD (€7) but student discounts available. Book 14 days in advance online - 60,000 daily limit (30k morning/30k afternoon). Visit morning session only as planned.

attractions.name: Jinli Ancient Street
attractions.notes: Historic pedestrian street with traditional architecture, local snacks, tea houses. Free admission. Can get crowded.

attractions.name: Kuanzhai Alley (Wide & Narrow Alleys)
attractions.notes: Optional visit if time permits. Traditional architecture, boutique shops, cafes. Within walking distance of Taikoo Li. Recommend 1-2 hours. Free admission.

attractions.name: Taikoo Li Chengdu
attractions.location: Central Chengdu (evening visit as per plan)
attractions.notes: Modern outdoor shopping complex. Blend of high-end retail and local culture. Walking distance from Kuanzhai Alley. Free to explore.

attractions.name: The Bund (Waitan) Waterfront Walk
attractions.notes: 1.5km stretch of colonial architecture. Free walk. 52 buildings in Gothic/baroque/neoclassical styles. Recommended route: Nanjing Road → Peace Hotel → The Bund → Waibaidu Bridge. Best at evening for lights. Metro Line 2/10 to East Nanjing Road Station.

attractions.name: People's Square (pass by)
attractions.notes: Major public square, pass through en route to other attractions. Metro hub. Free.

attractions.name: Huangpu Park
attractions.notes: Peaceful park with photo opportunities, day or night views. Free admission.

attractions.name: Café del Volcán
attractions.notes: French-inspired exterior, edgy interior. One of Shanghai's finest specialty coffee spots. Estimated €6 for coffee.

attractions.name: Rumors Coffee Roastery
attractions.notes: Hidden gem in quiet streets. Exceptional hand-brewed coffee and roasting. Sacred ground for serious coffee drinkers. INFJ perfect. Estimated €6.

attractions.name: Shanghai Disney Resort
attractions.notes: Full day visit. February is low season = lowest prices. Estimated 399-475 RMB (~€50-62/~$55-70 USD) for weekday. Children/seniors get 25% off. Book online in advance. New flexible refund policy from Jan 12, 2026. All day activity.

attractions.name: Museum of Art Pudong (MAP)
attractions.notes: Optional visit. Designed by Pritzker Prize winner Jean Nouvel. 6-story modern building near Huangpu River. Adults: 100-150 RMB (~€13-20), students 80-160 RMB. Prices vary by exhibition. Call 400-820-8771 for details.

attractions.name: Garden Books
attractions.notes: Widest selection of English-language books and literature in Shanghai. Perfect INFJ spot. Browse free, purchase optional.

attractions.name: Shanghai Foreign Language Book Store
attractions.notes: Entire building dedicated to English books - business, classics, romance, cookbooks, bestsellers. Free to browse.

attractions.name: iRen Study
attractions.notes: 24-hour unattended bookstore, only 14 sqm. Name derived from MBTI (introverts). Perfect for INFJ personality. Unique experience. Free to browse.

attractions.name: POP MART Shanghai Flagship Store
attractions.notes: Global flagship store with 2 levels of exclusive collectibles. Perfect for cute toy lovers. Budget €10-20 for small purchases.

attractions.name: Sonny Angel Stores (various locations)
attractions.notes: Available at multiple locations including foreign language bookstores. New Strawberry Love Series launched Jan 22, 2026. Budget €15-25.

attractions.name: The Press Café
attractions.notes: Beautifully restored former newspaper office. Unique atmosphere. Amazing coffee and breakfast spot. Estimated €6.

attractions.name: Metal Hands Coffee
attractions.notes: Top 50 Coffee Shops Worldwide - only Chinese mainland shop on list. World-class quality. Estimated €6.

attractions.name: Forbidden City (Palace Museum)
attractions.notes: Feb = low season: 40 RMB (~€5). Book online 1-7 days in advance (foreigners: passport + email only). 40,000 daily limit. Passport scan for entry, no paper ticket. Morning session recommended (before 12:00). Metro accessible. Allow 3-4 hours minimum.

attractions.name: Nanluoguxiang Hutong
attractions.notes: Optional. Traditional hutong with fashionable boutiques, bars, restaurants. Alternative: Beiluoguxiang (less crowded) with JM Cafe (old Beijing jasmine latte). Free to explore.

attractions.name: 798 Art District
attractions.notes: Optional. Nearly 200 galleries, exhibitions, art centers. Creative architecture, stylish boutiques, cafes, bookstores, handicraft shops. Free admission to district (individual galleries may charge).

attractions.name: PageOne Bookstore Sanlitun
attractions.location: Building 2, Taikoo Li Sanlitun South, 19 Sanlitun Lu, Beijing
attractions.notes: 'Most beautiful bookstore of Beijing'. Huge range of English books, design/art books, children's literature. Selection has grown significantly. Perfect INFJ spot. Free to browse.

attractions.name: POP MART Beijing Flagship Store
attractions.notes: Flagship store at Sanlitun Village. 189 sqm. Exclusive collectibles. Budget €10-20 for purchases.

attractions.name: Metal Hands Coffee
attractions.notes: One of first 'hipster' coffee shops in Beijing. Nordic interior. Famous nitrogen cold brew. Estimated €6.

attractions.name: Barista Coffee Roasters
attractions.notes: One of first new-wave cafés in Beijing. In-house roasted beans. Some of best brews in the city. Hidden hutong gem. Estimated €6.

attractions.name: RoOM Café
attractions.notes: Tucked away in quiet alley. Refreshing burst of greenery. Hidden hutong treasure. Estimated €6.

attractions.name: Dark Hill Coffee
attractions.notes: Specialty shop with up to 24 different beans daily. Perfect for pour-over enthusiasts. Yunnan jasmine-washed beans with natural floral aroma. Estimated €7.

attractions.name: Tian Roast Coffee Co.
attractions.location: Entrance of 798 Art District, hidden in alley, Beijing
attractions.notes: Hidden gem with cool ambiance. Quality beans. Tucked away location makes it special. Estimated €6.

attractions.name: Berrybeans Coffee
attractions.notes: Hidden gem in old Beijing. Extensive pour-over menu. Perfect INFJ atmosphere. Estimated €6.

attractions.name: Voyage Coffee
attractions.notes: Described as 'easily the best coffee we have had in China'. Cool place. Worth the visit. Estimated €6.

additional_notes.visa_info: China's 30-day visa-free policy extended until December 31, 2026

booking_tips.forbidden_city: MUST book 1-7 days in advance online. Foreign passport holders need passport + email only. Scan passport at entrance - no paper ticket needed.
booking_tips.panda_base: Book 14 days in advance. 60,000 daily limit. Morning visit (7:30-10:00) is when pandas are most active.
booking_tips.disney: Book online for best prices. February is low season = cheapest tickets. New flexible refund policy from Jan 12, 2026.

top_picks: Rumors Coffee Roastery (Shanghai) - hidden French Concession gem

pop_mart_locations: Shanghai: Nanjing Road Flagship / Shanghai IFC
sonny_angel_locations: Shanghai: Foreign language bookstore areas, multiple locations
cute_shopping.budget_estimate: €10-25 per store visit for small purchases

coffee_culture.shanghai: World's coffee capital - 9,533+ shops. Mix of curbside kiosks and hidden off-the-beaten-path spots.
coffee_culture.beijing: Historic hutongs are hidden treasure trove. Look for Nordic-inspired designs and in-house roasters.

shanghai: Shanghai Foreign Language Book Store (Fuzhou Lu) - entire building
